Package me.chloe.raiderlib.drive

Class DriveSystem

java.lang.Object
me.chloe.raiderlib.drive.DriveSystem
Direct Known Subclasses:
DifferentialDriveSystem, MecanumDriveSystem, SwerveDriveSystem
public class DriveSystem extends Object
Standardized constructor of a DriveTrain

    • enableSpinExporting

      public void enableSpinExporting()
      Will make PIDExporting drive and export RotateSpeed as opposed to X speed.

    • disableSpinExporting

      public void disableSpinExporting()
      Disable spin exporting mode.

    • enablePoseExporting

      public void enablePoseExporting()

    • disablePoseExporting

      public void disablePoseExporting()
      Disable spin exporting mode.

    • periodic

      public void periodic()
      Override for odometry. It is recommended that the super constructor be called as it enables the handling of XboxController-based driving as well as PIDExports. XboxController-based driving is disabled while in Autonomous to not screw up possible Autonomous drive handling.

    • driveRobotCentricMethod

    • enablePIDExport

      public void enablePIDExport()
      Enable PID Exporting (creates a file). I (Chloe) personally recommend to use an online PIDTuner to make tuning less of a trial and error thing. Although using exported PID data is not required, I have created an automated export process incase it is desired. Link to PIDTuner: https://pidtuner.com ++

    • exportPIDData

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command exportPIDData(DriveSystem.DriveExportMode driveExportMode)
      Enabling PIDExport of motor to be ran as a command.
      Parameters:
      driveExportMode - DriveExportMode enum
      Returns:
      Command runnable by WPILib's Command-based Structure

    • driveAllControlPercent

      public void driveAllControlPercent(double input)
      Method to drive forward and back (or use rotate speed if we are spinExporting is enabled).
      Parameters:
      input - ControlPercent speed (-1.0 to 1.0 with 0.0 being at rest)

    • followPathCommand

      public edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command followPathCommand(String pathName, boolean resetOdometry)
      Returns a command that follows a PathPlanner path by path name using the drive train's base methods
      Parameters:
      pathName - - Name of the path
      resetOdometry - - Usually true if this is the first path being followed
      Returns:
      Runnable command that follows a PathPlanner path by name.

      Parameters:
      traj - - PathPlannerTrajectory
      isFirstPath - - Resets the odometry if true
      Returns:

    • getDriverAxis

      public double getDriverAxis(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.PS4Controller.Axis axis, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.XboxController driver)
      A method to return the value of a driver joystick axis, which runs from -1.0 to 1.0, with a .1 dead zone(a 0 value returned if the joystick value is between -.1 and .1)
      Parameters:
      axis - double
      driver - XboxController
      Returns:
      value of the joystick, from -1.0 to 1.0 where 0.0 is centered

    • angleToRotationSpeed

      public double angleToRotationSpeed(double target, boolean radians)
      Use spin PIDController to convert an angle to robot rotateSpeed.
      Parameters:
      target - - Angle
      radians - - If true, accepts the target angle parameter as radians
      Returns:
      rotateSpeed to be used in ChassisSpeeds in radians per second
